channel.title: Talks By Spencer W. Kimball
channel.description: General Conference talks by Spencer W. Kimball.

image.title: General Conference talks by Spencer W. Kimball.

item.title: Voices of the Past, of the Present, of the Future
item.description: Address delivered at general conference Saturday morning, April 3, 1971

item.title: Glimpses of Heaven
item.description: Address delivered Sunday morning, October 3, 1971

item.title: Keep the Lines of Communication Strong
item.description: Address delivered Thursday morning, April 6, 1972

item.title: “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet”
item.description: Address delivered Friday morning, October 6, 1972

item.title: The Family Influence
item.description: Address delivered Sunday morning, April 8, 1973

item.title: The Rewards, the Blessings, the Promises
item.description: Address delivered at the Sunday afternoon session, October 7, 1973

item.title: Guidelines to Carry Forth the Work of God in Cleanliness
item.description: My brothers and sisters and friends, another April has come, and with it the birthdate of the Church, organized on the birthday of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ, which we have celebrated on the sixth of April. This weekend, we conduct the 144th An

item.title: What Do We Hear?
item.description: Beloved brethren and sisters, all you who are near and you who are afar, today we have participated in a solemn assembly. Solemn assemblies have been known among the Saints since the days of Israel. They have been of various kinds but generally have

item.title: Planning for a Full and Abundant Life
item.description: I am happy to be with you here tonight in this priesthood meeting. It is a particular delight to us to see the fathers and their sons coming early to the Saturday night priesthood meeting—many of them an hour or two early to be sure of a good seat, a

item.title: The Cause Is Just and Worthy
item.description: Now, beloved brethren and sisters, we come to the close of this glorious conference. We have heard from most of the Brethren. Their sermons and testimonies have been deep-rooted and sincere and stimulating. They have been inspired and have spoken to

item.title: God Will Not Be Mocked
item.description: My brothers and sisters and friends, how happy we are to see you here at this conference, the leaders and the members. We hope that you will be inspired by proceedings of this conference.

item.title: The Davids and the Goliaths
item.description: My brethren, it is wonderful to be with you here tonight, with an estimated 195,000 of us. And we pay tribute to you and express our affection for you.

item.title: Ocean Currents and Family Influences
item.description: I remember vividly my first view of an iceberg. In 1937 Sister Kimball and I made our first crossing of the Atlantic by steamer from Montreal, out through the St. Lawrence River and into the North Atlantic.

item.title: “Why Call Me Lord, Lord, and Do Not the Things Which I Say?”
item.description: This past week we have been celebrating the Easter week. Happy Easter to all of you! We read in the scripture:

item.title: To Bear the Priesthood Worthily
item.description: I have been wishing as I sat here and listened to these excellent sermons of these four Brethren tonight that all the boys in this world and every man in this world could hear sermons such as these to give them some concepts, some ideas, and some sta

item.title: Why Do We Continue to Tolerate Sin?
item.description: Beloved brethren and sisters, we are nearing the close of this semiannual conference which we have attended, and have enjoyed I hope.

item.title: The Time to Labor Is Now
item.description: We welcome you to this general conference, whether in the building or on the air. We convey to you our best wishes and our affection.

item.title: The Privilege of Holding the Priesthood
item.description: Brethren, it is a great thrill to think that we are part of a congregation of 225,000 men and boys. Some of you are a little darker, some of you have slant eyes, but you are all men and brethren, and we love you. We are grateful that you are associat

item.title: Spoken from Their Hearts
item.description: Brethren and sisters, it has been a glorious conference these three days, during these eight sessions. The Brethren have spoken from their hearts; they brought to our attention many of the great truths of the gospel of Jesus Christ, our Lord and Mast

item.title: There Is Still Much to Do
item.description: I have almost become converted to the welfare program this morning.

item.title: The Stone Cut without Hands
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, here we are again in this historic Tabernacle on Temple Square in Salt Lake City to consider matters of importance to the world, to the members, to ourselves.

item.title: Boys Need Heroes Close By
item.description: In the long decades that I have been coming to conference, I have been greatly impressed by the large number of young men—boys—who have come with their fathers. I have noticed time after time certain men who have grown in the Church, who have brought

item.title: Family Preparedness
item.description: Brethren and sisters, I commend to you the excellent addresses that have been given here this morning by Sister Barbara Smith, president of the Relief Society, and the Brethren.

item.title: Seeking Eternal Riches
item.description: Beloved brothers and sisters, after four days of conference meetings, we now approach the close of this general conference. It has been a time of rejoicing, for we have seen numerous of our beloved brothers and sisters from many countries all over th

item.title: A Report and a Challenge
item.description: This is the semiannual general conference of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, and we bid you welcome, you who are in attendance and you who are listening over radio and television, and we extend to you our love and our appreciation.

item.title: The Reconstitution of the First Quorum of the Seventy
item.description: Today we shall present four additional members of the First Quorum of the Seventy to you for your votes.

item.title: Our Own Liahona
item.description: Beloved brethren, I should like to say a few words to you if I may. What an opportunity it is to meet together under these auspices, 230,000 of us, possibly more. We welcome you again this night and ask the Lord to bless us while we are thus convened

item.title: A Program for Man
item.description: Beloved brothers and sisters, I will say just a brief word at the conclusion of this marvelous conference.

item.title: Loving One Another
item.description: Brethren and sisters, this has been a most desirable meeting. I have sat entranced. I know that we did not come here to be entertained; we came here to be instructed. I hope we have accepted this meeting in that tone, that we will take into our lives

item.title: The Lord Expects His Saints to Follow the Commandments
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, this is a happy day to address you concerning the work of the Lord, and its progress and development.

item.title: Our Great Potential
item.description: President Brigham Young, the second president of this dispensation, said: “It is supposed by this people that we have all the ordinances in our possession for life and salvation, and exaltation, and that we are administering in those ordinances. This

item.title: Revelation: The Word of the Lord to His Prophets
item.description: We have come to the close of these glorious days of great spiritual uplift, during which we have listened to words of inspiration and revelation from our presiding brethren. We have been blessed by hearing praises to the Lord sung by this great Taber

item.title: The Foundations of Righteousness
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, it is a joy to be with you again in another general conference.

item.title: Jesus the Christ
item.description: Beloved brothers and sisters, we come to the close of this great conference. We have been much benefited and blessed. You have heard thirty or more speakers bear testimony of the divinity of Jesus Christ, and I should like to say it was He, Jesus Chr

item.title: Welfare Services: The Gospel in Action
item.description: Singing this song [“Improve the Shining Moments”] takes me back some generations. My beloved mother, who died early in my life, used to hum this song as she went about the house preparing the meals and taking care of our home. So it’s very dear to me

item.title: The True Way of Life and Salvation
item.description: I come to you today, my brothers and sisters, in the spirit of appreciation, not only for our opportunity to gather again in a setting of religious freedom and in appreciation for the devotion of the faithful Saints in the Church, but as one who has

item.title: Listen to the Prophets
item.description: Beloved brothers and sisters, wasn’t it a happy moment when we were permitted to be here today to hear that beautiful testimony of Brother LeGrand Richards? and the four new members of the First Quorum of the Seventy who poured out their hearts in th

item.title: Becoming the Pure in Heart
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, what a beautiful sight you are! The radiance of your faces and the beauties of nature on this Temple Square make my heart swell with thanksgiving for the blessings of the Lord. As we meet together in conference, I hope t

item.title: “Hold Fast to the Iron Rod”
item.description: The Church has been greatly saddened by the passing of Elder Delbert L. Stapley of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles. He died on August 19, 1978. Elder Stapley served faithfully and ably in the Twelve for twenty-eight years. His presence will be miss

item.title: Fundamental Principles to Ponder and Live
item.description: It is a great joy to greet the priesthood of the Church this glorious night. All over the world we gather to worship the Lord and give him praise.

item.title: An Eternal Hope in Christ
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, we came together to wait upon the Lord, to be cleansed and edified by his Spirit, and to know in our hearts the spirit of true worship.

item.title: The Fruit of Our Welfare Services Labors
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I greet you at this harvest time with the earnest hope that we follow the counsel of the Lord to have our

item.title: Fortify Your Homes Against Evil
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I greet you with the warmest feelings of love and gratitude at this, the opening of the divinely appointed world conference of the Lord’s church—The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Preparing for Service in the Church
item.description: Brethren, we have had a rich experience this night, listening to the servants of the Lord. They have given to us words of truth and righteousness. I hope that these words have sunk deep into the hearts of all those who have been listening tonight.

item.title: Let Us Move Forward and Upward
item.description: Beloved brethren and sisters, this has been a glorious conference. We are grateful to all who have taken part in any way. My heart has rejoiced, and my thoughts have been inspired to turn to many things, as what has been said and sung has deeply touc

item.title: Applying the Principles of Welfare Services
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, what sweetness fills the soul at conference time. How grateful I am to share the spirit of this hour with you, to feel your spirit and strength, and to recognize your work and your accomplishments.

item.title: “We Need a Listening Ear”
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters all over the world, this morning I express our greetings to Elders Gene R. Cook and F. Enzio Busche, who are ill at this time. I greet you this morning with deepest feelings of love and gratitude at this, the opening s

item.title: Our Sisters in the Church
item.description: Beloved brethren, it was wonderful to hear President Tanner give such an excellent address, telling how we attempt to do the Lord’s work in his Church. I’m sure there are many people who do not know what goes on in the Church. I’m sure that this will

item.title: “Give Me This Mountain”
item.description: Beloved brothers and sisters, is there anyone who doesn’t know Brother LeGrand Richards, who has just spoken? Is there anyone who doesn’t know the great missionary he has been? When I was a member of the stake presidency in Arizona, Brother Richards

item.title: “No Unhallowed Hand Can Stop the Work”
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, I am grateful, as always, just to be with you and to be near you. These last six months I have felt your love and support and prayers, time and time again, and wish to thank you most sincerely for them.

item.title: Introduction to the Proclamation
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, it is a deeply moving and wonderful experience to stand here today where the Prophet Joseph Smith stood 150 years ago. We came here last night by jet airplane from Salt Lake City. We made the trip in a matter of a half-d

item.title: Remarks and Dedication of the Fayette, New York, Buildings
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, I am grateful for this opportunity. It was a thrilling experience to speak to you a few minutes ago from the Peter Whitmer farm home where the Church was organized. It is now an inspiring experience to be in this love

item.title: “Let Us Not Weary in Well Doing”
item.description: This has been a glorious conference, my brothers and sisters! I have felt close to those of you in the Tabernacle, even though we are separated by a whole continent.

item.title: A Deep Commitment to the Principles of Welfare Service
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, I have enjoyed this meeting very much, and I endorse all that has been presented by the various speakers.

item.title: “Learn—Then Teach”
item.description: The following addresses were delivered at the General Relief Society Meeting held Saturday evening, September 27, in the Tabernacle, Salt Lake City. Latter-day Saint women eighteen and older met in nine nations and 2,051 locations worldwide to hear m

item.title: Families Can Be Eternal
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, I am happy to greet you at this opening session of our 150th semiannual world conference of the Church.

item.title: Ministering to the Needs of Members
item.description: My dear brethren, it is always a great joy for me to have the privilege of meeting with you in general priesthood meeting. We are gathered here in the Tabernacle on Temple Square in Salt Lake City and in more than 2,000 other places around the world.

item.title: “Do Not Weary by the Way”
item.description: What a joy it is to be in this conference and to hear the word of the Lord as it has been given by so many of the Brethren. As always, my brothers and sisters, I am thankful, personally, as well as in behalf of the Church members, for the counsel and

item.title: The Law of Tithing
item.description: My dear brothers and sisters, my message today is not a new one. Prophets of all dispensations have clearly taught the law of tithing and the principles of the gospel with regard thereto. From the beginning we have been taught that “the earth is the

item.title: A Report of My Stewardship
item.description: Once again I rejoice, my brothers and sisters, at the opportunity to be with you in a general conference of the Church. In many ways, the October conference of six months ago seems like yesterday, yet we have been so busy, and so much has happened, i

item.title: Rendering Service to Others
item.description: My dear brethren, I greet you as you are assembled here in the Salt Lake Tabernacle and in hundreds of other meeting places around the world. We are so pleased with the able leadership provided by the priesthood bearers of the Church—at all levels! A

item.title: We Are on the Lord’s Errand
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, this has been a glorious conference. We are grateful to all who have taken part in any way. My heart has been touched, and I have rejoiced and been inspired as I listened to the beautiful music and the timely messages

item.title: Follow the Fundamentals
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters: As I have pondered the social and economic conditions which confront us today, my thoughts have taken me back to our pioneer heritage. Our people have always been challenged by many and varied hardships which have tri

item.title: Remember the Mission of the Church
item.description: (Read by his personal secretary, D. Arthur Haycock)

item.title: The Lord Is at the Helm
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, this is a great experience for me. I have waited for this day and hoped for it and believed for it. I have a great love for the people of this Church, and gratitude for the love expressed by them and by all the people

item.title: The Lord Expects Righteousness
item.description: (Read by his personal secretary, D. Arthur Haycock)

item.title: Set Some Personal Goals
item.description: A videotape presentation followed featuring these extracts from talks given by President Kimball in past general conference priesthood sessions.
